sentence: Watkins told VICE News that while at the rally he had tried to speak to Arizona state Rep. Mark Finchem, who has promoted QAnon conspiracies, and who is seeking election in November as secretary of state.
author: David Gilbert
title: QAnon Thought Leader Ron Watkins Is Running for Congress. It’s Going Terribly.

sentence: Not former state Rep. Mark Finchem, now running for Arizona secretary of state.
author: EJ Montini
title: Arizona's Jan. 6 insurrectionists should be barred from holding office

sentence: House investigators also want to speak with Mark Finchem, an Arizona state representative and current candidate for Arizona secretary of state, who was in D.C. on Jan. 6.
author: Josh Kovensky
title: Jan. 6 Committee Subpoenas Republican State Lawmakers, Trump Campaign Officials

sentence: Two Republican state lawmakers — Pennsylvania senator Doug Mastriano and Arizona senator Mark Finchem — also received subpoenas from Mr Thompson on Monday.
author: Andrew Feinberg
title: Capitol riot committee subpoenas Trump campaign officials and state lawmakers involved in sham elector plot

sentence: Trump campaign official Michael Roman, in charge of Election Day operations in 2020, and his deputy Gary Michael Brown, will receive a subpoena, as will Republican state lawmakers from Pennsylvania and Arizona – Douglas Mastriano and Mark Finchem, respectively.
title: Biden rejects Trump's executive privilege claim and orders the release of ALL White House visitor logs to the January 6 committee

sentence: Some state legislators who had contacts with Giuliani as part of the scam have been subpoenaed by the panel, such as Mark Finchem in Arizona and Doug Mastriano in Pennsylvania, who are, respectively, running in 2022 to be secretary of state and governor in moves that raise fears of future attempts to subvert American democracy.
author: Peter Stone
title: Giuliani’s legal problems deepen as ‘false electors’ scheme investigated

sentence: Free Speech For People filed lawsuits on behalf of voters in Arizona’s Maricopa County that challenge the eligibility for the office of GOP Reps. Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs, and state Rep. Mark Finchem.
author: Seth McLaughlin
title: Liberals push legal effort to block Republican ‘insurrectionists’ from the ballot

sentence: At least not with Republicans, who have long called themselves the “the party of the Constitution.” Because if words mattered, if the Constitution mattered, the GOP would fully support the effort to bar U.S. Reps. Andy Biggs and Paul Gosar, as well as state Rep. Mark Finchem from holding office.
author: EJ Montini
title: Honor the Constitution and ban Arizona's insurrectionists from holding public office

sentence: The lawsuits sought to disqualify Gosar, Biggs and state Rep. Mark Finchem by citing a section of the 14th Amendment to the U.S. constitution enacted after the Civil War.
title: Judge dismisses ballot challenges against Gosar, Biggs, Finchem

sentence: They filed a lawsuit to stop Reps Paul Gosar, Andy Biggs, and State House Rep Mark Finchem alleging that they participated in an “insurrection” stemming from the Jan 6 riot.
author: Faye Higbee
title: Democrats Attempt to Disqualify Reps Gosar, Biggs, Finchem; Court Dismissed the Attempt.
